column1: Aase syndrome is a rare disorder that involves anemia and certain joint and skeletal deformities.
The health care provider will perform a physical exam.
Treatment may involve blood transfusions in the first year of life to treat anemia.
A steroid medicine called prednisone has also been used to treat anemia associated with Aase syndrome.
A bone marrow transplant may be necessary if other treatment fails.
Complications related to anemia include: - Fatigue - Decreased oxygen in the blood - Weakness Heart problems can lead to a variety of complications, depending on the specific defect.
Severe cases of Aase syndrome have been associated with stillbirth or early death.
